flowRoot.flowPara: these values encode level of 'trust' in the model?
details of the model need to be viewable easily, so that you don't have to guess which model is which...
sliders can be annoying when adjusting for exact values, maybe typing in values and showing a bar graph would be bertter.
in Bayes optimal classifier terms, this is the likelihood that the training dataset i ssampled from a system with that hypothesis held true, P(h_i)

text.tspan: models combined using Bayes optimal classifier:

flowRoot.flowPara: probability of classes given each hypothesis
h = v1 has 60% correlation with c1
deterministic models can be interpreted as gaussian probility around estimated value.
probability of training data given hypothesis is true
how likely is each class to appear in the model? Flat distribution of values? Gaussian around a mean?
Many models may assume each state is equally likely, but models may be improved by statistical estmates of probability distribution across classes
How much faith do you have in this theory?
This value is up to the experimenter.
